alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 1:33PM MST until January 11 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, extreme cold. Wind chills as low as 70 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, Polebridge, Essex, and Bad Rock Canyon. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
